longInfo:
Passport required. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Czech Rep. can obtain a
multiple entry visa on arrival for a max. stay of 2 weeks.
Fee: BHD 25.- . Extension of stay possible for an additional 2
weeks. 
- E-visas can be applied for at www.evisa.gov.bh . Applicants
  are required to print and hold a copy of the e-visa.
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Czech Rep. will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors must hold proof of sufficient funds and provide an
  address (place of stay) in Bahrain. 
- Visitors are required to hold documents required for their
  next destination .
Warning:
- Nationals of Czech Rep. who have visited or have transited
  Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria or Sierra Leone within the last 21
  days will be refused entry. 
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever is required if arriving
within 6 days after leaving or transiting countries with risk
of yellow fever transmission For details, click here. 

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission within 12 hours if not leaving the transit
  areas.
